abstracts.cdata!:
Project outcome is rated unsatisfactory.
            The many activities initiated under the project--and
            particularly the institutional development interventions,
            civil works, stocking of health centers--are not sustainable
            without government support. That support is unlikely given
            the government's on-going fiscal crisis and lack of
            institutional commitment. world Bank performance is adjudged
            unsatisfactory overall: The Bank made a concerted effort to
            design and supervise the project well, in the face of severe
            limitiations. However, the Bank demonstrated questionable
            judgement in the change in orientation of the project and
            the extension of the closing date. Overall Borrower
            performance was also rated unsatisfactory: Many positive
            aspects of the implementing agency 's performance were
            dwarfed by the overwhelming constraints associated with the
            political and economic upheaval affecting Haiti during the
            1990s. Some of the lessons learned are: Under the right
            conditions, public-private partnerships can help to mitigate
            institutional constraints. Supply-driven public sector
            projects cannot overcome systemic constraints. Basic
            implementation capacity is essential. Governance of
            acceptable quality and basic implementation capacity are
            essential for the success of a Bank operation. Small,
            simple, and well-defined operations will work better than
            more wide-ranging projects. Changes in the nature of public
            sector employment may only be realized on a government-wide basis.
